content.raw:
Not sure how to reproduce it, but here's a backtrace. It happened while testing pull request #1506.

~~~
Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.


Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff3ca11a8 in QEventLoop::exit(int) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff3ca11a8 in QEventLoop::exit(int) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#1  0x00007ffff4600d9a in QMenu::~QMenu() () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#2  0x00007ffff77e5e3e in gazebo::gui::ModelRightMenu::Run (this=0x69d9c0, _entityName=..., _pt=..., 
    _type=_type@entry=gazebo::gui::ModelRightMenu::LINK)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/ModelRightMenu.cc:222
#3  0x00007ffff7779da0 in gazebo::gui::GLWidget::OnMouseReleaseNormal (this=this@entry=0x1069610)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc:781
#4  0x00007ffff777a168 in gazebo::gui::GLWidget::OnMouseRelease (this=0x1069610)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc:510
#5  0x00007ffff77e765f in operator() (a0=..., this=0x10b09c8) at /usr/include/boost/function/function_template.hpp:767
#6  gazebo::gui::MouseEventHandler::Handle (this=<optimized out>, _event=..., _list=...)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/MouseEventHandler.cc:134
#7  0x00007ffff77e76b9 in gazebo::gui::MouseEventHandler::HandleRelease (this=<optimized out>, _event=...)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/MouseEventHandler.cc:94
#8  0x00007ffff777830c in gazebo::gui::GLWidget::mouseReleaseEvent (this=0x1069610, _event=0x7fffffffd440)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc:689
#9  0x00007ffff422350a in QWidget::event(QEvent*) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#10 0x00007ffff41d3e2c in QApplicationPrivate::notify_helper(QObject*, QEvent*) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#11 0x00007ffff41da5dd in QApplication::notify(QObject*, QEvent*) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#12 0x00007ffff3ca24dd in QCoreApplication::notifyInternal(QObject*, QEvent*) ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#13 0x00007ffff41d9d93 in QApplicationPrivate::sendMouseEvent(QWidget*, QMouseEvent*, QWidget*, QWidget*, QWidget**, QPoint---Type <return> to continue, or q <return> to quit---
er<QWidget>&, bool) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#14 0x00007ffff424e9cb in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#15 0x00007ffff424e269 in QApplication::x11ProcessEvent(_XEvent*) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#16 0x00007ffff4275b02 in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#17 0x00007fffefe24e04 in g_main_context_dispatch () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#18 0x00007fffefe25048 in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#19 0x00007fffefe250ec in g_main_context_iteration () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0

content.html:
Not sure how to reproduce it, but here's a backtrace. It happened while testing pull request #1506.

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.


Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff3ca11a8 in QEventLoop::exit(int) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
(gdb) bt

    _type=_type@entry=gazebo::gui::ModelRightMenu::LINK)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/ModelRightMenu.cc:222
#3  0x00007ffff7779da0 in gazebo::gui::GLWidget::OnMouseReleaseNormal (this=this@entry=0x1069610)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboA/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc:781

er<QWidget>&, bool) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
